text: The 1st Battalion, 26th Marines (1/26) is an inactive infantry battalion of the United States Marine Corps. They were part of the 26th Marine Regiment and 5th Marine Division and fought during the Battle of Iwo Jima in World War II. They were activated again for the Vietnam War but were deactivated after the war and remain inactive today. ==Notable former members== *Robert Hugo Dunlap, recipient of the Medal of Honor *Jacklyn H. Lucas, recipient of the Medal of Honor *Bob Parsons, rifleman during the Vietnam War *Daniel C. Pollock, recipient of the Navy Cross ==See also== * History of the United States Marine Corps * List of United States Marine Corps battalions ==References== Category:Infantry battalions of the United States Marine Corps Category:Inactive units of the United States Marine Corps
title: 1st Battalion, 26th Marines
